qas.question: What type of foreign policy has Estonia sought after getting their independence?
What were the most important foreign policy priorities?

answers.text: accession into NATO and the European Union

qas.question: What trend has accompanied Estonia's cooperation with Western powers?

context: Since regaining independence, Estonia has pursued a foreign policy of <a0_0>close co-operation<a0_0/> with its Western European partners. The two most important policy objectives in this regard have been <a1_0>accession into NATO and the European Union<a1_0/>, achieved in March and May 2004 respectively. Estonia's international realignment toward the West has been accompanied by a general <a2_0>deterioration in relations with Russia<a2_0/>, most recently demonstrated by the protest triggered by the controversial relocation of the Bronze Soldier World War II memorial in Tallinn.
